list.name: Changes
list.comment: Save point for prior to compilation. Will branch off after this save

task.summary: Default task
Project initializing and structure set
Project initializing and structure set
Base foundation created to launch blank window - ready for GUI styling and design
Stiched together the top menu, central panel and the blank bottom panel. Added temp values and logo. Ready for the individual day slides
Stitched together the top menu, central panel and the blank bottom panel. Added temp values and logo. Ready for the individual day slides
Stitched together the top menu, central panel and the blank bottom panel. Added temp values and logo. Ready for the individual day slides
Created ForecastCells to contain and display weather forecasts
Updating gitignore
Updating gitignore
Created APIDriver to handle fetch request to open-meteo. Starting with static test url to fill in UI and then will add in user defined search
Reworked somethings to get the structure better and the code cleaner. Getting ready to start testing methods of loading API data into weather cells
Refactored API driver - improved the flow and parsing methods to retrieve the values from API response
Everything is finally working great to load 7 days worth with values pulled from Forecast obj. Next up is putting additional days onto a rail for a weeks forecast
Added the concept of the weekday forecast to the model to decouple code better. Reworking to change from loading static test to being driven by UI interactions

Many refactors: Moved loading weather from WindowController to Model.java, logic being the weather needs to be accessible across whole program and not just window load. Now pulls forecast from model to use in window load
Now have the week's worth of values loading into the cells and populating the labels with their values correctly.
Added weather code conversion to add weather status to forecast cell along with day active status. Ready for SVG selection and add to cell
Added the weather images to the forecast cells that load an image based on the weather code. Started with SVGs but learned they don't work well with javafx and changed to png
Applied color and some style tweaks for the UI and changed the weather images from black icons to white
Added in the wind direction and speed to the forecast card. Created functions to turn their response into cardinal direction arrow pngs.
Last save point before adding in city based searching using the text field.
Configured the app to load a welcome page, currently working on retrieving a geo look up for city and state to retrieve lat and long for weather search.
Have the text field trimming and now sorting through the results for a city and state match and returns lat and long

Combined the Geo and Weather APIs. Now when the button is pressed, it searches for the city, state for lat/long and then fetches weather response. Now to swap the central panel view with the forecast after
Refactored a bit for the new flow. Will now start looking into how to swap out the welcome panel with the forecast panel. Having trouble supporting multiple fxmls under 1 controller.

Now that panels need to start flowing right, I've corrected the structure for the Window and views. Controllers correctly created for top menu & weather panel now and removed the logic for each from the window controller.
Now that the weather loads, we have an issue of the fetching of weather blocking the thread and not displaying loading panel. Ready to implement Task threading to resolve
Swapped http calls to threads. Still not displaying loading interstitial but working to resolve with some clutter fixed
Finally found the solution for the loading screen. Reworked the flow of code to use threads now and unblocked the GUI. Loading works perfectly now.
App is working with background threading. Autocomplete binding is added. Saving before adding SQLite server to store city/state/lat/long to remove lat&long network call
After adjustments to DB and some tweaks, lat and long are now returned from SQLite db function. Additional files for debugging and changes will be cleaned up in next versions
SQLite server properly fetching lat and long to use in the weather api call. Changed ViewFactory to create a new forecast panel for each search to support other city searches after the first
Save point for prior to compilation. Will branch off after this save

MESSAGE.value: Reworked somethings to get the structure better and the code cleaner. Getting ready to start testing methods of loading API data into weather cells
Refactored API driver - improved the flow and parsing methods to retrieve the values from API response
Everything is finally working great to load 7 days worth with values pulled from Forecast obj. Next up is putting additional days onto a rail for a weeks forecast
Added the concept of the weekday forecast to the model to decouple code better. Reworking to change from loading static test to being driven by UI interactions

Many refactors: Moved loading weather from WindowController to Model.java, logic being the weather needs to be accessible across whole program and not just window load. Now pulls forecast from model to use in window load
Now have the week's worth of values loading into the cells and populating the labels with their values correctly.
Added weather code conversion to add weather status to forecast cell along with day active status. Ready for SVG selection and add to cell
Added the weather images to the forecast cells that load an image based on the weather code. Started with SVGs but learned they don't work well with javafx and changed to png
Applied color and some style tweaks for the UI and changed the weather images from black icons to white
Added in the wind direction and speed to the forecast card. Created functions to turn their response into cardinal direction arrow pngs.
Last save point before adding in city based searching using the text field.
Configured the app to load a welcome page, currently working on retrieving a geo look up for city and state to retrieve lat and long for weather search.
Have the text field trimming and now sorting through the results for a city and state match and returns lat and long

Combined the Geo and Weather APIs. Now when the button is pressed, it searches for the city, state for lat/long and then fetches weather response. Now to swap the central panel view with the forecast after
Refactored a bit for the new flow. Will now start looking into how to swap out the welcome panel with the forecast panel. Having trouble supporting multiple fxmls under 1 controller.

Now that panels need to start flowing right, I've corrected the structure for the Window and views. Controllers correctly created for top menu & weather panel now and removed the logic for each from the window controller.
Now that the weather loads, we have an issue of the fetching of weather blocking the thread and not displaying loading panel. Ready to implement Task threading to resolve
Swapped http calls to threads. Still not displaying loading interstitial but working to resolve with some clutter fixed
Finally found the solution for the loading screen. Reworked the flow of code to use threads now and unblocked the GUI. Loading works perfectly now.
App is working with background threading. Autocomplete binding is added. Saving before adding SQLite server to store city/state/lat/long to remove lat&long network call
Created a SQLite DB to hold all cities data. This DB look up will replace the network call to get lat and long. This update will halve the network calls to make it faster
After adjustments to DB and some tweaks, lat and long are now returned from SQLite db function
After adjustments to DB and some tweaks, lat and long are now returned from SQLite db function. Additional files for debugging and changes will be cleaned up in next versions
SQLite server properly fetching lat and long to use in the weather api call. Changed ViewFactory to create a new forecast panel for each search to support other city searches after the first
Save point for prior to compilation. Will branch off after this save
